newsitem.title: USA: BNN Corp revises earnings upwards.
newsitem.headline: BNN Corp revises earnings upwards.

text.p: BNN Corp said on Thursday that it had revised its earnings forecast upwards by at least $4 million over three years relative to a joint venture between its Kaleidoscope Media Group subsidiary and Interpublic Group of Cos.

BNN also announced on Thursday that the joint venture, called Kaleidoscope Sports and Entertainment LLC, had agreed in principal with General Motors to manage cross organizational events in sports, entertainment and special events marketing.
Details of the agreement were not disclosed, but BNN said General Motors would release the terms of the deal at a later date.
BNN previously anticipated earnings in excess of $6 million from its 49 percent ownership of Kaleidoscope Sports and Entertainment over a three-year period.

But as a result of the General Motors agreement, the company said it expected profits from the IPG transaction to be more than $10 million over the same period, "assuming that the IPG option is not exercised."
If the option is exercised, BNN Corp said it will realize a profit from the transaction in excess of $20 million.
BNN Corp is a sports and entertainment company.
